frame.name: Religious_belief
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Believer</fen> has faith in a piece of <fen>Content</fen> or an <fen>Element</fen> which fits into a religious belief system made up of many articles of faith. The <fen>Content</fen> is not necessarily tied to direct sensory experience. The system of beliefs may be enshrined by the members of a social group
<ex>Do <fex name="Believer">Muslims</fex> <t>believe</t> <fex name="el">in the virgin birth of Jesus?</fex></ex> <ex><fex name="Believer">Muslims</fex> <t>believe</t> <fex name="el">in only One God, the same God that Jews and Christians believe in</fex>, but some of the ideas about the nature of God are different</ex> <ex><fex name="Believer">Muslims</fex> <t>believe</t> <fex name="Content">that the month of Ramadan is the holiest month of the year</fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Believer
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Believer</fen> is the person whose religious beliefs are in question.</def-root>

FE.name: Content
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Content</fen> is the object of the <fen>Believer</fen>'s religious conviction. <fen>Content</fen> can be expressed as a finite clause or in a in-PP Complement.
<ex> A Christian <t>believes</t> <fex name="Cont">that Jesus of Nazareth was a prophet</fex>. </ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Role
FE.definition:
<def-root><fen>Role</fen> is a function that an Element of the faith is believed to serve.
<ex>If a person <t>believes</t> in Jesus <fex name="Role">as his Saviour</fex>, he can he baptized.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Element
FE.definition:
<def-root>A predefined, fixed idea to which reference is made throughout the belief system.
<ex>I believe <fex name="Element">in Jesus</fex></ex> <ex>To Clark, who infinitely <t>believes</t> <fex name="el">in angels</fex> and celebrating the holidays with loved ones, Christmas means kids and family.</ex></def-root>
